location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.547 of 1855 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter and its enclosure relate to the recent seizure and release of the bugla [buggalow, or boat] Sumherein the Gulf, which Kemball reported previously was caught transporting slaves. The enclosure with Andersonâ€™s letter is an extract of paragraph 11 of despatch no.32 of 1854 from the Court of Directors, dated 22 November 1854. The extract states that, while it was proper for the vessel to be released, it is not clear whether the slaves found on board have been liberated.
